description: The CER segment adds detailed information regarding the formal authorizations to provide a service (e.g. licenses, certificates) held by the health professional identified by the STF segment.

1.name: Set ID – CER
1.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one; for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two; etc.

10.name: Certificate Type
10.description: This field specifies the certificate's classification, e.g., being a privilege, permission, or qualification certificate.

11.name: Certificate Domain
11.description: This field specifies the subject area to which the certificate is applicable, e.g., administrative, medical, or nursing issues.

12.name: Subject ID
12.description: This field expresses the identifier of the certificate's subject as used by the certifying body. (The subject is the owner of the certificate, e.g., person, organization, device, application, component.) If the certificate is expressed as a X.509 document this field is required.
12.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

13.name: Subject Name
13.description: This field defines the name of the subject of the certificate as used by the certifying body.

14.name: Subject Directory Attribute Extension
14.description: In individual identity certificates, this Subject Directory Attribute extension MAY contain a Healthcare Professional Role attribute and may contain a Qualified Certificate Statement attribute. In addition, Subject Directory Attributes MAY contain other attributes not specified by this technical specification.

15.name: Subject Public Key Info
15.description: This field contains the algorithm identifier. Referred to this field, the X.509 extension field MAY contain a Subject Public Key Identifier to identify the public key used in the Subject Public Key Info.

16.name: Authority Key Identifier
16.description: The Authority Key Identifier extension SHALL identify the public key to be used to verify the signature of the certificate. It enables distinct keys, used by one CA, to be distinguished (e.g., as key updating occurs).

17.name: Basic Constraint
17.description: The Basic Constraints extension contains a boolean used to specify whether or not the subject can act as a CA (certificate authority), using the certified key to sign certificates.
17.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

18.name: CRL Distribution Point
18.description: The Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Distribution Point extension SHALL identify the location of the associated CRL (or Authority Revocation List (ARL) for attribute certificates) in the PKI directory.

19.name: Jurisdiction Country
19.description: This field contains the country for which the qualification is valid. Refer to HL7 Table 0399 - Country Code for valid values.
19.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

2.name: Serial Number
2.description: The serial number uniquely identifies the attribute certificate within the scope of its issuer. This field contains the number and/or characters that identify the certificate held by the health professional.

20.name: Jurisdiction State/Province
20.description: This field contains the state for which the qualification is valid. HL7 suggests using values in User-defined Table 0347 - State/Province.

21.name: Jurisdiction County/Parish
21.description: This field contains the county/parish for which the qualification is valid. HL7 suggests using values in User-defined Table 0289 - County/Parish.

22.name: Jurisdiction Breadth
22.description: This field contains the breadth/extent of the jurisdiction where the qualification is valid. HL7 suggests using values in User-defined Table 0547 - Jurisdictional Breadth .

23.name: Granting Date
23.description: This field contains the date when the certificate was granted.

24.name: Issuing Date
24.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate was issued.

25.name: Activation Date
25.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate became or will become active.

26.name: Inactivation Date
26.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate became or will become inactive.

27.name: Expiration Date
27.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate expires or will expire.

28.name: Renewal Date
28.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate must/will/ be / has been renewed.

29.name: Revocation Date
29.description: This field contains the date/time when the certificate has been revoked.

3.name: Version
3.description: The version number differentiates among different versions of the attribute certificate.

30.name: Revocation Reason Code
30.description: This field contains the reason for revoking the certificate (e.g., having been compromised, changes of conditions/environment, etc.)

31.name: Certificate Status Code
31.description: This field contains the state of the certificate held by the health professional. HL7 suggest using values in User-defined table 0536 - Certificate Status .

4.name: Granting Authority
4.description: It specifies the authority that granted the certificate to the person.
4.data_type: XON - Extended Composite Name and Identification Number for Organizations

5.name: Issuing Authority
5.description: Specifies the authority that issued the certificate to the person.
5.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

6.name: Signature of Issuing Authority
6.description: Digital Signature of the certifying authority. The Digital Signature includes a seal concept and is verifiable.

7.name: Granting Country
7.description: ID of the country granting the certificate. Refer to HL7 Table 0399 - Country Code for valid values.
7.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

8.name: Granting State/Province
8.description: State/province granting the certificate. Refer to HL7 Table 0347 - State/Province for valid values (in Chapter 2)

9.name: Granting County/Parish
9.description: County/parish granting the certificate. Refer to HL7 Table 0289 - County/Parish for valid values (in Chapter 2).
